trans-unit.source: Mobile device security policy settings | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Mobile device security policy settings | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use Intune to configure a wide range of settings that you can deploy to managed devices in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Use Intune to configure a wide range of settings that you can deploy to managed devices in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Mobile device security policy settings in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Mobile device security policy settings in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Intune now features separate configuration policies for each device platform.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Intune now features separate configuration policies for each device platform.

trans-unit.source: These policies contain the most up-to-date settings that you can use.
trans-unit.target: These policies contain the most up-to-date settings that you can use.

trans-unit.source: You can continue to use the mobile device security policy, and any existing deployments will still work.
trans-unit.target: You can continue to use the mobile device security policy, and any existing deployments will still work.

trans-unit.source: However, you should plan to migrate to the new configuration policies as soon as possible because the mobile device security policy will be removed in the future.
trans-unit.target: However, you should plan to migrate to the new configuration policies as soon as possible because the mobile device security policy will be removed in the future.

trans-unit.source: You can use Intune mobile device security policies to configure a wide range of settings that you can deploy to managed devices in your organization.
trans-unit.target: You can use Intune mobile device security policies to configure a wide range of settings that you can deploy to managed devices in your organization.

trans-unit.source: These settings are used to control the functionality and security of your devices.
trans-unit.target: These settings are used to control the functionality and security of your devices.

trans-unit.source: You can create and deploy mobile device security policies for the following device types:
trans-unit.target: You can create and deploy mobile device security policies for the following device types:

trans-unit.source: Windows RT 8.1 and enrolled Windows 8.1 devices
trans-unit.target: Windows RT 8.1 and enrolled Windows 8.1 devices

trans-unit.source: Some settings are not applicable to some devices.
trans-unit.target: Some settings are not applicable to some devices.

trans-unit.source: See the tables below for a full list of settings that you can configure.
trans-unit.target: See the tables below for a full list of settings that you can configure.

trans-unit.source: **Require a password to unlock mobile devices**
trans-unit.target: **Require a password to unlock mobile devices**

trans-unit.source: This setting specifies the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only or alphanumeric.
trans-unit.target: This setting specifies the type of password that will be required, such as numeric only or alphanumeric.

trans-unit.source: **Required password type – Minimum number of character sets**
trans-unit.target: **Required password type – Minimum number of character sets**

trans-unit.source: There are four character sets: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.
trans-unit.target: There are four character sets: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, numbers, and symbols.

trans-unit.source: This setting specifies how many different character sets must be included in the password.
trans-unit.target: This setting specifies how many different character sets must be included in the password.

trans-unit.source: However, for iOS devices, this specifies the number of symbol characters that must be included in the password.
trans-unit.target: However, for iOS devices, this specifies the number of symbol characters that must be included in the password.

trans-unit.source: **Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped**
trans-unit.target: **Number of repeated sign-in failures to allow before the device is wiped**

trans-unit.source: **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off**<sup>1</sup>
trans-unit.target: **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off**<sup>1</sup>

trans-unit.source: **Remember password history** – **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**
trans-unit.target: **Remember password history** – **Prevent reuse of previous passwords**

trans-unit.source: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**
trans-unit.target: **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**

trans-unit.source: <sup>1</sup>For iOS devices, when you configure the settings **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off** and **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**, they are applied in sequence.
trans-unit.target: <sup>1</sup>For iOS devices, when you configure the settings **Minutes of inactivity before screen turns off** and **Minutes of inactivity before password is required**, they are applied in sequence.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you set the value for both settings to **5** minutes, the screen will turn off automatically after 5 minutes, and the device will be locked after an additional 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you set the value for both settings to **5** minutes, the screen will turn off automatically after 5 minutes, and the device will be locked after an additional 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: However, if the user turns off the screen manually, the second setting is immediately applied.
trans-unit.target: However, if the user turns off the screen manually, the second setting is immediately applied.

trans-unit.source: In the same example, after the user turns off the screen, the device will lock 5 minutes later.
trans-unit.target: In the same example, after the user turns off the screen, the device will lock 5 minutes later.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy a password length policy to devices that run Windows RT, users will be forced to reset their password—even if their current password complies with the policy requirements.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy a password length policy to devices that run Windows RT, users will be forced to reset their password—even if their current password complies with the policy requirements.

trans-unit.source: For Windows Phone 8 devices, you must set this to **Yes**.
trans-unit.target: For Windows Phone 8 devices, you must set this to **Yes**.

trans-unit.source: To enable encryption on iOS devices, enable the setting **Require a password to unlock mobile devices**.
trans-unit.target: To enable encryption on iOS devices, enable the setting **Require a password to unlock mobile devices**.

trans-unit.source: This setting applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.
trans-unit.target: This setting applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.

trans-unit.source: Apps and associated data are automatically encrypted.
trans-unit.target: Apps and associated data are automatically encrypted.

trans-unit.source: <sup>1</sup>Here is additional information for devices that run Windows 8.1:
trans-unit.target: <sup>1</sup>Here is additional information for devices that run Windows 8.1:

trans-unit.source: To enforce encryption on devices that run Windows 8.1, you must install the [December 2014 MDM client update for Windows](http://support.microsoft.com/kb/3013816) on each device.
trans-unit.target: To enforce encryption on devices that run Windows 8.1, you must install the [December 2014 MDM client update for Windows](http://support.microsoft.com/kb/3013816) on each device.

trans-unit.source: If you enable this setting for Windows 8.1 devices, all users of the device must have a Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: If you enable this setting for Windows 8.1 devices, all users of the device must have a Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: For encryption to work, the device must meet the Microsoft [InstantGo](http://blogs.windows.com/bloggingwindows/2014/06/19/instantgo-a-better-way-to-sleep/) hardware certification requirements.
trans-unit.target: For encryption to work, the device must meet the Microsoft [InstantGo](http://blogs.windows.com/bloggingwindows/2014/06/19/instantgo-a-better-way-to-sleep/) hardware certification requirements.

trans-unit.source: When you enforce encryption on a device, the recovery key is only accessible from the user's Microsoft account, which is accessed from their OneDrive account.
trans-unit.target: When you enforce encryption on a device, the recovery key is only accessible from the user's Microsoft account, which is accessed from their OneDrive account.

trans-unit.source: You cannot recover this key on behalf of a user.
trans-unit.target: You cannot recover this key on behalf of a user.

trans-unit.source: **Require automatic updates – Minimum classification of updates to install automatically**
trans-unit.target: **Require automatic updates – Minimum classification of updates to install automatically**

trans-unit.source: Choose the classification of updates that will be installed automatically:
trans-unit.target: Choose the classification of updates that will be installed automatically:

trans-unit.source: Installs all updates that are classified as important.
trans-unit.target: Installs all updates that are classified as important.

trans-unit.source: Installs all updates that are classified as important or recommended.
trans-unit.target: Installs all updates that are classified as important or recommended.

trans-unit.source: This setting sets the URL of the work folder to allow documents to be synchronized across devices.
trans-unit.target: This setting sets the URL of the work folder to allow documents to be synchronized across devices.

trans-unit.source: This setting applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.
trans-unit.target: This setting applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.

trans-unit.source: **Allow mobile devices that don’t fully support these settings to synchronize with Exchange (Exchange ActiveSync)**
trans-unit.target: **Allow mobile devices that don’t fully support these settings to synchronize with Exchange (Exchange ActiveSync)**

trans-unit.source: This setting applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.
trans-unit.target: This setting applies to devices that are managed by Exchange ActiveSync also.

trans-unit.source: **Make Microsoft account optional in Windows Mail application**
trans-unit.target: **Make Microsoft account optional in Windows Mail application**

trans-unit.source: **Allow intranet site for single word entry**
trans-unit.target: **Allow intranet site for single word entry**

trans-unit.source: (This setting allows the use of a single word to direct Internet Explorer to a website—for example, ‘Bing’.)
trans-unit.target: (This setting allows the use of a single word to direct Internet Explorer to a website—for example, ‘Bing’.)

trans-unit.source: **Require a password to access application store**
trans-unit.target: **Require a password to access application store**

trans-unit.source: **Allow managed documents in other unmanaged apps**
trans-unit.target: **Allow managed documents in other unmanaged apps**

trans-unit.source: **Allow unmanaged documents in other managed apps**
trans-unit.target: **Allow unmanaged documents in other managed apps**

trans-unit.source: **Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots**
trans-unit.target: **Allow automatic connection to free Wi-Fi hotspots**

trans-unit.source: This setting sends information about Wi-Fi connections to help discover nearby connections.
trans-unit.target: This setting sends information about Wi-Fi connections to help discover nearby connections.

trans-unit.source: This setting allows the device to utilize location information.
trans-unit.target: This setting allows the device to utilize location information.

trans-unit.source: This setting allows operations that use near-field communication.
trans-unit.target: This setting allows operations that use near-field communication.

trans-unit.source: If this setting is disabled, the setting **Number of repeated sign in failures to allow before the device is wiped** for Samsung KNOX devices does not function.
trans-unit.target: If this setting is disabled, the setting **Number of repeated sign in failures to allow before the device is wiped** for Samsung KNOX devices does not function.

trans-unit.source: **Allow voice assistant while device is locked**
trans-unit.target: **Allow voice assistant while device is locked**

trans-unit.source: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md)
trans-unit.target: [Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies](manage-settings-and-features-on-your-devices-with-microsoft-intune-policies.md)
